datasets.name: data.csv
datasets.description: Related to aircraft, pilots, and aviation history.

columns.name: flight_hours_per_year_of_experience
columns.description: Total flight hours divided by the years of flying experience

columns.name: pilot_id
columns.description: Unique identifier for each pilot

columns.name: years_with_current_airline
columns.description: Number of years the pilot has been with their current airline

columns.name: employs_active_breaks
columns.description: Indicator if the pilot intentionally takes breaks that involve physical activity during gaming

columns.name: weekly_gaming_hours
columns.description: Number of hours a pilot spends on video gaming weekly

columns.name: advanced_navigation_system_training
columns.description: Whether the pilot has undergone specific training for advanced navigation systems.

columns.name: international_flight_experience
columns.description: Indicates whether the pilot has experience flying internationally across different time zones.

columns.name: advanced_aerodynamics_training_hours
columns.description: Total number of hours a pilot has spent in advanced aerodynamics training

columns.name: social_media_followers
columns.description: Number of followers a pilot has on aviation-related social media platforms

columns.name: education_level
columns.description: Highest academic qualification of the pilot

columns.name: airline_fleet_technology_level
columns.description: Technological advancement level of airline's fleet

columns.name: international_flights_frequency
columns.description: Number of international flights a pilot flies on average per year

columns.name: aviation_incident_awareness_score
columns.description: A score representing a pilot's awareness and understanding of previous aviation incidents, higher being better knowledgeable.

columns.name: average_flight_altitude
columns.description: The average altitude at which the pilot operates, measured in feet.

columns.name: international_flight_hours
columns.description: Total hours the pilot has flown on international routes

columns.name: age
columns.description: Age of the pilot

columns.name: years_of_flying_experience
columns.description: Total years of flying experience for the pilot

columns.name: predicted_type_of_aircraft_frequently_flew
columns.description: Likely type of aircraft frequently flown by the pilot based on certain criteria

columns.name: stress_management_type
columns.description: Type of stress management technique used by the pilot

columns.name: aircraft_type_size
columns.description: Size category of aircraft typically flown by the pilot

columns.name: flies_multi_engine_aircraft
columns.description: Whether the pilot flies multi-engine aircraft regularly

columns.name: mental_calculation_frequency
columns.description: Frequency of engaging in activities that require mental calculation per week

columns.name: frequency_of_simulation_training
columns.description: Number of simulation training sessions attended by the pilot per year

queries.question: Is there a relationship between the social media followers of pilots and the type of aircraft they frequently fly?
queries.true_hypothesis: Pilots who have a large number of followers on aviation-related social media channels and a high aviation incident awareness score, along with specific advanced navigation system training, are more likely to fly Commercial aircraft. Pilots with fewer social media followers and relatively lower advanced aerodynamics training hours, especially those who also have multiple engine aircraft experience, are more likely to fly Private aircraft. Pilots with even lower social media followers and possibly depending on flying over mountainous terrain may be inclined to fly Cargo aircraft.
